Socialism and Christianity, however, are by no means entirely unrelated. Nor is their relationship merely antagonism. Socialism is of its very nature, indeed, erroneous and of evil tendency‚ seeing that one-sidedness and exaggeration are precisely what is distinctiva of it; and it does not contain any truth or any good principle which is exclusively its own. But it is not, therefore, to be thought of as without any tmth or good in it; or as to be utterly condemned and opposed. There is much in it which is not distinctive of it or exclusively characteristic of it.
